docs.title: Visitors
docs.text:
Never been to the space? Great, we like new visitors! Here's how to get in:

  • Find our location
  • Consider saying hi on our communications channels
  • It's always a good idea to bring something to do, your laptop, or your pet project
  • Bring friends! Hacking is more fun with others.

docs.title: Register a new user
docs.text:
Steps to create a new bar account for a new member:

  1. Update the members.beancount file on Github/0x20/tab-data/static/members.beancount
  2. Important: the membername is case-sensitive and has to start with an uppercase!
  3. Add the new user and add mm_name to receive barbot Mattermost message for each transaction. Example commit
  4. Press the 'Sync' button on the bar display
  5. The new account should be available on the very end of the list

docs.title: Instructions for Connecting to the Bluetooth Speaker
docs.text:
Follow these steps to connect your device to the Bluetooth speaker setup.

  1. Turn on the Cambridge Audio amplifier.
  2. Rotate the dial to Bluetooth input.
  3. Press the button on the Philips Bluetooth pairing device.
  4. Connect your device to "PhilipsBT".

docs.title: CNC Machine
docs.text: The space has a 3 axis CNC machine based on the High-Z S-720 from CNC-STEP. To use the machine either 1T, Elvis, Teus or Sander should be present.

docs.title: Safety
docs.text:
The machine has two E-stops (emergency stops). One is located on the x-axis gantry and another one on the electronics box. When pressed they cut the voltage to the spindle, motors and controller board. Extra informatino about implementation: It cuts off the controller board which also deprives the steppers of current. The spindle circuit is cut off using a seperate relay.

When operating the machine: - Don't go near the moving axis or spindle - Always Wear earprotection - Don't leave it unattended - Stay attentive and be ready to hit the e-stop

docs.title: Designing CNC Routines
docs.text:
To start your CNC project, the first step is to design the part in CAD software like Fusion 360. Fusion 360 can also generate toolpaths for the CNC machine, but this is not an automatic process and is outside the scope of this document.

For a very simple part, this 17-minute(!) video gives you an idea of how to get started: Fusion 360 CAM Tutorial for Beginners! FF102.

If you get stuck, I (1T) and Evils can possibly help you get started.

docs.title: Starting the machine
docs.text: Now that you have your routine you can start preparing the CNC machine.

docs.title: Energizing the machine
docs.text:
• Plug in the machine
  • Make sure both estops are not activated
  • Press the green energize button on the electronics box

docs.title: Launch gcode sender
docs.text:
Turn on the CNC laptop or CNC computer and launch gsender. Other options will work too but we found this option to be the easiest one to use.

After launching gsender you should see the homescreen with a greyed-out button that says disconnected.

Go to the top left, make sure the firmware is set to grblHAL and not grbl, go to recognized devices and choose the USB option.

After this the greyed-out button should become green and say connected. You are now ready to start moving the machine.

docs.title: Homing and moving the machine
docs.text:
• Always start by pressing the 🏠 Home button in the top right
  • After that you can move the axises but keep in mind that nothing stops you from ramming the machine into the stock material.

The machine will not stop itself from destroying itself so be careful!

docs.title: Running the routine (WIP)
docs.text: Upload your routine and press start? Next time we do make a new part I'll take some screenshots.

docs.title: Wiring
docs.text: Overview of wiring.

docs.title: Wiring at the gantry E-stop distribution box
12-part cable
docs.text:
• 🔵 Blue: x1-limit switch
  • 🟢 Green: x2-limit switch
  • 💿 Gray: y-limit switch
  • 🌸 Pink: z-limit switch
  • 🟡 Yellow: Ground
  • 🧬 Shielding: Ground
  • 🟤 Brown: c-limit switch
  • 🔴🔵 Red and Blue Striped: E-stop button located on the gantry.
  • 🟠💿 Orange and Gray Striped: E-stop button located on the gantry.
  • 🔴 Red: Not Connected
  • ⚫ Black: Not Connected
  • 🟣 Purple: Not Connected
  • ⚪ White: Not Connected

docs.title: 3-part cable for the x2 limit-switch
docs.text:
• 🟢 Green: x2-limit switch
  • ⚪ White: Ground
  • 🟤 Brown: Not Connected

docs.title: Wiring at the DB9 ST-connector
docs.text: 1) 🟤 Brown: c-limit switch 2) 🔵 Blue: x1-limit switch 3) 💿 Gray: y-limit switch 4) 🌸 Pink: z-limit switch 5) 🔴🔵 Red and Blue Striped: E-stop button located on the gantry. 6) Not Connected 7) 🟢 Green: x2-limit switch 8) 🟠💿 Orange and Gray Striped: E-stop button located on the gantry. 9) 🟡 Yellow: Ground 10) 🧬 Shielding: Ground

docs.title: Register a new user
docs.text:
1. create a new user on the UDM Pro and put the new user in the Hackerspace Members group
  2. click the button to register an NFC tag, and swipe it on the correct reader when the system tells you to do. This can be done either locally (gateway IP) or through the remote control panel https://unifi.ui.com. Data is stored locally, and it doesn't need internet or a cloud service to work.

It's fail open for fire safety because we do not have any other way to exit.

docs.title: Doorbell
docs.text:
Very straightforward implementation:

  • A ring the bell button on https://hackerspace.gent/landing/contact.php that writes a file on disk containing a timestamp
  • A cronjob on the Pi (pi@10.51.3.195) that is connected to the flappers that checks every x amount of seconds if a new file is written
  • When an updated timestamp if found, instruct the flappers

docs.title: Bambulab mini
docs.text:
This printer is property of mateo and miker, but free to use if you know what you're doing (if not, ask help).

The printer is configured in LAN-only mode, and can be accessed on the network via OrcaSlicer software. Install the proprietary network plugin, click on Device, click on add printer. Don't choose "Add with PIN code" and instead go to "Other Devices" and select the "hackerspace bamboo mini".

After that it asks for a 8 digit PIN that you can find in Settings > Lan Only Mode.

DNS: bambu-mini.lan.0x20.be
